The resulting sketch should resemble a distorted rectangle with curved corners due to the specific points used. Now, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0312 to adjust its size, as indicated by the "sketch\\_scale" parameter provided in the JSON. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the obtained euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 3D model by extending the sketch by a distance of 0.75 toward the normal, and 0.0 in the opposite direction of the normal. The euler angles for this system should be set to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the translation vector should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will serve as the origin for the first part of the CAD model. Next, create the 2D sketch for the first part on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch should contain a single face (face_1). On face_1, create the following loops and curves: 1. Loop_1 consists of 4 lines (line_1, line_2, line_3, and line_4): - line_1 starts at [0.0, 0.0] and ends at [0.0312, 0.0]. - line_2 starts at [0.0312, 0.0] and ends at [0.0312, 0.0156]. - line_3 starts at [0.0312, 0.0156] and ends at [0.0, 0.0156]. - line_4 starts at [0.0, 0.0156] and ends at [0.0, 0.0]. The resulting sketch should resemble a distorted rectangle with curved corners due to the specific points used. Now, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0312 to adjust its size, as indicated by the "sketch_scale" parameter provided in the JSON. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the obtained euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 3D model by extending the sketch by a distance of 0.75 toward the normal, and 0.0 in the opposite direction of the normal.</description>

Perform a join operation with existing bodies. 1. **Extrusion Properties** - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.0682 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.75 - Operation: JoinFeatureOperation Once you have completed these steps, the first intermediate part will be created, forming the circular metal object.
